    Khaled Beydoun: The War on Terror Made Trump's Islamophobia A Reality

    26 Sep 2017
    Click here to download

    Islamophobia is conventionally regarded as racist and bigoted views about Muslims expressed by ignorant individuals, including the one who somehow became president. But legal and critical race scholar @KhaledBeydoun explains that the reality is more complicated. The War on Terror perpetrated state-backed Islamophobia, which nurtured and bolstered popular anti-Muslim bigotry. Support us at Patreon.com/TheDig . Check out Beydoun’s article https://columbialawreview.org/content/islamophobia-toward-a-legal-definition-and-framework/.

    Topics: Imperialism and Foreign Policy Racism War on Terror
    Guests: Khaled Beydoun
